result.execSummary:
The defendant John M DeJesus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber. Sentence credit of 9 days were
granted if imposed.
Probation may be transferred to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs. Balance to be paid as a condition of probation.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.

Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid Driver's license. AODA Assessment and follow through. Maintain absolute sobriety, comply with random urine screens. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. Commencing forthwith. STAYED for use at agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John M DeJesus

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant John M DeJesus in court with attorney Nicole M Masnica.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for plea/sentencing hearing. Defendant enters a guilty plea to count #1. Court performs plea colloquy and finds defendant guilty of count #1. 
State gives sentencing recommendations. Atty Masnica makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes Statements. 

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT#1:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

180 DAYS HUBER (CREDIT 9 days) 

6 MONTHS DL REVOCATION

TERM OF PROBATION:  18 months   ***TRANSFER ALLOWED TO MILWAUKEE***

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid Drivers License. 
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

COSTS:  $268.00 + $250.00 DNA surcharge. To be paid out of cash bail posted, remainder to be paid as a condition of probation.

CONDITION TIME: 30 days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence forthwith, STAYED for use of probation agent. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
   
Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 29, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Nicole M. Masnica in court.   Defendant John M DeJesus did not appear.   Debra Lynn Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court received information from WCS stating that Defendant contacted their office stating that he did not have transportation to court today.  Attorney Masnica verifies such information.  Court adjourns.    Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 8, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant John M DeJesus in court with Attorney Sam Benedict for Attorney Nicole M. Masnica.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Lucas Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Benedict requests an adjourned date for plea hearing (Attorney Masnica ill today).  Court adjourns for plea.    Bail remains as fixed.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 5, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Filed by the State.
